column1: The new SSG Michael Ollis Ferry has already been delayed long enough. So when COVID pushed it even further @HeyNowJO and I got to work. Proud to help cut through the red tape to bring this back on schedule and improve the commutes. https://t.co/wlgJwmsRJ4

NEW AD: When the pandemic hit we stood up a COVID-only hospital in just 6 days and got the first drive-thru testing site in the whole city right here in #NY11.  When the Mayor choked we got the job done. Always have and always will. https://t.co/RBW0G5np4s
This is everything we hate about politics. If it wasn’t clear before it is now: the only person standing in the way of COVID relief is Mitch McConnell. https://t.co/9C92hHvJLR

Let’s be clear: politics and elections cannot and must not be a factor in COVID relief negotiations. People are hurting and the last thing they care about is who in Washington gets credit for doing our jobs. Leaders in both parties need to stop the posturing and get a deal done. https://t.co/V5rB5kM2rf

I have consistently stood up to leadership in both parties and fought for bipartisan bold COVID relief. The consequences of not doing so would be catastrophic for first responders public servants and all the people of #NY11. #NY11debate https://t.co/WN5zVTvWjn

At the height of the COVID pandemic @NMalliotakis shared a photoshopped picture of herself on the frontlines cut $400 million from our hospitals and protected shady nursing homes from being held accountable. #NY11debate https://t.co/sI1BVQUWjy

I am honored to have @NYNurses’ support. When COVID hit nurses risked everything to save lives. They are the definition of heroes. But @NMalliotakis shared photoshopped pictures of herself on the frontlines and cut $400 million from our hospitals and the nurses who work there. https://t.co/0Gc9YSV0Hy

Failing to provide federal COVID relief will have very real devastating consequences for Staten Islanders and South Brooklynites. Our neighbors are already struggling to make ends meet and our small businesses will only continue closing.

We’re on the verge of economic collapse in NYC unless we get a substantive COVID relief bill passed. I won’t stop fighting to get a bipartisan deal and am proud to be joined today by State Senator @DianeSavino and Assemblymember @Michael_Cusick to continue pushing. https://t.co/hk9v3coVZ4

I know I’m no Pete Davidson but I’m glad we got to talk about getting the vital COVID relief that the people of Staten Island and South Brooklyn desperately need. Thanks for having me on -- check out Pt. 2 on Monday! https://t.co/1l3EgPzX8k

Even though leaders in Washington have given up -- I haven’t and I won’t. We can and must pass bold bipartisan COVID relief that extends unemployment supports our small businesses and yes provides aid for our state and local governments. https://t.co/XHe9ukyFQ9
I voted against Heroes 2.0 because it represents a failure by both parties to come to a deal on real COVID-19 relief. We can’t give up. We must put country first. https://t.co/eft8zSgkF6

Higher tolls and cutting transit improvements in not an option. That is why I’ve continued to push leadership in both parties to stop the political games and pass a substantive COVID relief bill. The stakes could not be higher. https://t.co/uxDBsk7rHM

When the pandemic was at its peak Dr. Malik did whatever possible to revamp her lab to bring COVID-19 testing to Staten Island. I was proud to work with her to help get the approvals and supplies necessary for her to get the job done. https://t.co/4WAqSMPGq6

COVID relief is critical--and possible. When lives and economies are on the line we can’t shrink from our responsibility. We’re Americans first not Democrats or Republicans. That’s how we should govern and that’s how I’ll always fight for #NY11. https://t.co/T8s0p0svnq

Once again Nicole Malliotakis has put party before her constituents. Instead of pushing for desperately needed COVID relief she demanded the Senate focus on a partisan Supreme Court battle. https://t.co/e6W1JWxTEw

Great Sunday catching up with shoppers across the island. Everyone is sick of the partisan games and wants to see us come together and get a deal on COVID relief. I’m going back to DC to continue fighting for them. https://t.co/xO60ALLLQ3

When the city shut down our union brothers and sisters kept going. It is up to us to have their backs like they had ours both here at home and in Washington. It’s time to stop playing games and pass a COVID relief bill get our economy back on track and take care of our own. https://t.co/LVHiH2IktM
Today I joined Democrats and Republicans in an effort to break the impasse on a COVID relief bill. We’re all sick of the games. It’s long past time to put the country first. https://t.co/gDnzsET3ca

After a weekend of great conversations on both ends of the Verrazzano I headed down to DC this morning to make sure Staten Island and South Brooklyn continue to get the coronavirus relief we need and deserve. That’s what this job is all about—listening and delivering results. https://t.co/ggJHrT1Brq

When the coronavirus hit @HeyNowJO and I called on @NYCMayor to deploy military medical personnel to Staten Island’s two hospitals saying “leaving Staten Island out of the deployment is inexplicable.” https://t.co/vXVQdfuxMD

Mitch McConnell wants New York to go bankrupt and his “skinny” COVID relief proposal is only further proof he wants our cops firefighters first responders and public servants to be fired. The consequences of the Senate’s failure are dire. https://t.co/QJD7GoaqNZ

While the coronavirus has only made our efforts to #EndOverdose more difficult it hasn't changed our resolve.  I'm proud to have secured increased funding to those on the frontlines but this #IOAD2020 let's all remember the work that still remains. https://t.co/qQESjnfxr9

Earlier this week I talked to @Fox5NY about why additional COVID relief is so critical. Millions are still out of work and the need for state and local aid is dire. We cannot afford to play partisan games when people are hurting. Let’s get it done. https://t.co/Lu15z63ggw

From waiting till the last minute to extend orders to slashing federal funding for the National Guard this Administration has continued to nickel and dime our soldiers who are on the frontlines fighting against COVID.  It's dangerous and disrespectful.  https://t.co/Z9fb3rXoyh

“This proposal is proof that Mitch McConnell wants to fire cops first responders teachers and those who have been on the frontlines putting their lives on the line in the fight against COVID-19” said Rep. Max Rose (D-N.Y.). https://t.co/nISQOqL1nU

Our children and teachers are the ones paying the price for Mitch McConnell's inaction to fund our states and cities whose budgets have been slashed by COVID. I won't rest until we get the funding we desperately need. [NY1] https://t.co/JTU4AvEj7S

Yemeni-Americans have faced incredible pain and hardship that has only been made worse by the coronavirus pandemic. I'm proud to have been able to help several families who were stranded return home but the fact is more needs to be done and fast. https://t.co/UHoTIiIRpN

“From the opioid epidemic to trade to our intellectual property China has a long history of trying to rip off America. Why should we think the coronavirus pandemic would be any different?” Rose asked.  https://t.co/xwR70Gm0PO

MTA announces a halt to all major projects maintaining the broken status quo. NYC faces 22000 potential layoffs due to COVID budget gaps.  Mitch McConnell: "I don’t think we have yet felt the urgency of acting immediately." https://t.co/oXHOrzi1i0

Expanding COVID-19 testing remains critical in our fight against this virus and I refuse to give up on getting South Brooklyn the test sites it needs. I’m proud to have led the charge with @ACPNY and @NYGovCuomo to bring another test site to Bay Ridge. https://t.co/ztVTCU2QdJ

“In a time of a global pandemic lies cost lives” Rep. Max Rose told The Post. “Reports of the Communist Chinese government downplaying the severity of the coronavirus while simultaneously stockpiling PPE strikes to the core of why they cannot be trusted” https://t.co/VLyyFS26sZ

We are at the epicenter of COVID-19 and seniors in nursing homes across Staten Island and Brooklyn are at an extremely high risk of falling ill. I urge FEMA to prioritize these vulnerable populations across my district and to do it as soon as possible. https://t.co/s866Y2iltq

Tragically @NYGovCuomo just announced that domestic violence rates have been dramatically increasing in the last few months. While staying home will help us stop the spread of #COVID unfortunately for too many home isn't safe.  Please share this number and resource: https://t.co/fpvZicuCIx

Incredible work by Dr. Ginny Mantello @HeyNowJO and @RUMCSI to come together and make this happen.  The seniors and staff of Staten Island’s nursing homes will now be able to receive vital #COVID19 testing.  https://t.co/1gcwVUMF5B

In order for us to beat this pandemic we need to seriously ramp up our testing—which includes antibody testing. I am proud that one of Brooklyn’s laboratories is able to begin this critical next step to overcoming the coronavirus.  https://t.co/UrFz7TNGuF

Seeing the incredible sacrifices being made each and every day gives me hope that we will beat the coronavirus because we're the greatest country on earth.  Thank you for having me on @TheView today to talk about the path forward and what it's going to take. https://t.co/tAb5FfFfER

Nothing would make me happier than to see this president utilize all the tools at his disposal to win this war against the coronavirus.   Unfortunately we have not yet seen his administration assert its authority in the ways that it could.   https://t.co/FtkV9plTDq

In order to win the war against coronavirus and re-open our communities we need to dramatically increase COVID19 and antibody testing and the production of PPE. Only the federal gov can effectively do that and it's time it steps up and gets it done. https://t.co/C9qUQ1HngF

In just a matter of days we were able to set up the state’s first COVID-only facility—right here on Staten Island. But what struck me even more was seeing the incredible sacrifices doctors nurses and medical professionals are making each and every day.  https://t.co/GwNxsJBQrS

I am certain that we will win this war against the coronavirus but it will take all of us banding together supporting these heroes on the front lines and fighting to ensure all impacted by this crisis are made whole.

I've wrapped up my two-week deployment with the National Guard where we helped set up a COVID-only emergency hospital on Staten Island—but my service pales in comparison to the sacrifices of all those on the front lines of this war. https://t.co/JpqC6PCKdi

Tomorrow I will be deploying to the National Guard to try and do my part to beat Coronavirus here on Staten Island. I hope that everyone continues to stay safe and healthy. There is no doubt in my mind that as the greatest city in the world we will overcome this. https://t.co/s9l6hmidNY

Our Island lost one of New York’s Bravest to COVID-19. I am thinking of James Villecco his family and every member of the FDNY today. I promise that we will beat this disease together. https://t.co/gVfBb1oE3x
Our hospitals are the frontlines of our war against #COVID19. I won’t stop fighting for our medical professionals and first responders.  https://t.co/MND6bHXCZX

1200+ more beds coming to Staten Island will be critical to ensure our hospitals are able to stay ahead of the #COVID19 surge.   Thank you @NYGovCuomo @realDonaldTrump @csinews for the quick action. Lives are on the line. https://t.co/7MQQ87MxGC
As a combat veteran opening up the VA to civilian patients is not something I take lightly but the fact is we're at war with the coronavirus.  https://t.co/7ru7XZddSv

Drove down to DC late last night to make sure we get this #COVID19 disaster aid bill passed without delay.   People are hurting and need relief NOW.   By no means is our work done. Will keep fighting to make sure NY and all those affected are made whole.
We must stay ahead of the COVID-19 surge and every option to increase hospital capacity needs to be explored—including deploying a military field hospital to Ft. Hamilton.   https://t.co/8dz4c0fTU2

Our community has suffered a tragic loss from COVID-19 with the passing of Rabbi Romi Cohn z"l. Was truly an honor to host him his family and loved ones in DC just a few months ago.  Keeping them all in my prayers.  https://t.co/pHv5X7t6QG

We can't overstate the severity of #COVID19 but as New Yorkers there's nothing we can't overcome.  This is going to take a whole of society approach but I won't stop fighting until we're fully prepared and through this crisis.  Thanks @patkiernan @NY1 for having me on this AM. https://t.co/MK09dX2Tp3

I called for the US Naval Ship Comfort to be deployed to NYC because our hospitals are facing a surge in patients from coronavirus. Learn more about why it was so important that we got this done here:  https://t.co/ifiOGMwD8P  @wcbs880

NEWS: The first drive-through #COVID19 testing site will open on Staten Island TOMORROW in the parking lot of South Beach Psychiatric Center 777 Seaview Ave.  Testing will be by appt. only and all New Yorkers will need to call NYSDOH Hotline to schedule: 888-364-3065 https://t.co/V6BXATqe1J

Staten Islanders who are exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms are rightfully frustrated which is why we need more tests more hospital capacity and faster access to services ASAP and I won't stop fighting until we get there. https://t.co/QrVjUC3ZzQ

I'm leading a call to deploy the Navy's hospital ship to NYC because we need the full force of government working together to combat the coronavirus.   We’re in the heart of the storm and this would make a huge impact. https://t.co/tuU32GG4KM

New York is at an inflection point with #coronavirus. While it’s critically important that we drastically increase testing capabilities it’s equally important that we do everything we can to stem the spread of #COVIDー19.

We must ensure economic security to protect our public health. Proud to have helped pass this bipartisan bill to address the #coronavirus by providing paid leave free testing and expanded food security.  We have more work ahead but this is critical. https://t.co/Nb6o6GBkws

To protect our most vulnerable from #coronavirus hard decisions like restricting visitors to nursing homes closing senior centers and limiting big crowds are necessary—as @HeyNowJO and I have advised.  Please be safe and follow public health guidance. https://t.co/OXOUf4d17b

Automated #coronavirus testing is critical to expanding capacity and getting tests for everyone who needs it. I've been pushing the FDA and CDC for quick approvals of this—and will continue leading this charge—because it needed to happen yesterday. https://t.co/ARxkd87Qvz

It’s extremely concerning that the President didn’t mention any plans to increase testing capacity at all.   #coronavirus is here and the hospitals in my state lack the ability to test all who need it quickly and save lives in the process.   FDA & CDC needed to act yesterday.
